intro: Dianthus hispanicus var. australis, commonly known as the Australian carnation, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of pink or red petals with a distinctive central boss. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant blooms and long-lasting flowers.
